아. 나 자신도 생일을 잊고 지내던 참이었는데, 그날 아버지가 나에게 돈을 보내주셨더군. 그리고 젊은이 취향은 모르니까 스스로 뭔가 사서 스스로 축하하라고 하시더라.

Oh. I had almost forgotten about my birthday myself, but that day my father sent me some money. And he told me to buy myself something and celebrate it myself, because I don't know what young people's tastes are.

I didn't know what I should buy to celebrate, so I just stared at the entrance to the shopping district. #s Until I was discovered by my sister. She dragged me through everything I could play with on that street and spent all my money. #s Then bought me a suit.

I was in a daze, not knowing what to buy, when my sister found me. #sShe pulled me along, went to all the places in the shopping district where we could play, and spent all our money. #sAnd finally, she bought me a suit.
她说要去做大事的人不能无所准备，而且她当年毕业时候的第一件便宜西服根本不贴身，穿出去像是卖保险的。#s所以她不会让我丢同样的脸。
その時姉は、大きなことをするなら準備を整えるべきだと教えてくれた。卒業時に買った安いスーツが体に合わず、保険の営業みたいになってしまった教訓だそうだ。……私に同じ恥をかかせたくなかったのかもしれないね。
그때 언니는, 큰일을 하려면 준비를 갖춰야 한다고 말해주었어. 졸업할 때 산 싸구려 양복이 몸에 맞지 않아 보험 판매원처럼 보였다는 교훈 때문이랬지. …… 나에게 같은 망신을 시키고 싶지 않았던 걸지도 모르지.

She said people who are going for great things can't go unprepared, and that her first cheap suit back when she graduated didn't fit her at all and she wore it out like she was selling insurance. #s So she won't make me lose the same face.

My sister told me then that if you're going to do something big, you should be prepared. She said it was a lesson she learned from the cheap suit she bought at graduation that didn't fit her and made her look like an insurance salesman. Maybe she didn't want ...... me to have the same embarrassment.
她一边吃着甜点一边抱怨过去工作有多讨人厌，我不知道那些职场话题应该怎么回应才算有趣，所以只能一支低头喝饮料，偶尔瞟一眼她的脸。#s直到日暮西垂，我们各自回家。
姉はスイーツを食べながら、これまでの仕事がどれほど嫌だったか愚痴をこぼしたが、私はただ下を向いて飲み物を飲み、たまに姉の顔を覗くだけだった。#sそうしているうちに日が沈み、私たちはそれぞれ家に帰った。
언니는 디저트를 먹으며 지금까지의 일이 얼마나 싫었던지 투덜대었지만, 나는 그저 고개를 숙이고 음료를 마시며, 가끔 언니 얼굴을 쳐다볼 뿐이었어.#s 그러던 사이 해가 저물었고, 우리는 각자 집으로 돌아갔지.

She was eating her dessert and complaining about how obnoxious her job used to be, and I didn't know how to respond to all that workplace talk in a way that would be interesting, so all I could do was sip my drink with my head down, occasionally glancing at her face. #s Until the sun goes down and we each go home.

My sister ate her sweets and complained about how much she hated her job so far, while I just looked down and drank my drink and occasionally looked into her face. #sIn the meantime, the sun went down and we each went home.
但我第一次感觉到，我原来是被人爱着的，有人在意我的存在，如果我就这么消失在这个世界上，会有人哀伤。
